text: Denmark seem to be completely losing control of the situation. More restrictions were added earlier in December, but the numbers kept rising nevertheless. We now have nearly twice the number of hospitalized as we did at the spring peak, and the Christmas infections hasn't even hit yet. We are about to have the new year's evening parties, which are traditionally drunk and disinhibited, and this with a population already weary of the restrictions. New restrictions will be announced by the prime minister in one hour. Unless restrictions are truly draconian, I expect the situation to completely derail the next two weeks.

text:
They’ve very carefully so far kept all restrictions to the business sector and public buildings / infrastructure, with zero regulations regarding peoples bodies (including both vaccines and things like curfews or mandatory mask-wearing outside) or private homes. That’s the main difference between the DK approach and that of many other countries. I really hope that can continue as I greatly applaud it + I think it leads to much better compliance. If that philosophy is kept, the only remaining restrictions I could see would be
1. closing non-online supermarkets (I don’t think we have the infrastructure for that)
2. closing kindergartens, nurseries and daycare (probably with little effect)
3. reduce the public gathering loft to e.g. 4
4. stricter testing rules for those so-far-unvaccinated employed in the care sector
